content:
The OmniScript Email Action uses the Salesforce Email API to send an email template or body defined in the action configuration to a user, lead, or contact. 

The Use Template checkbox determines whether using an email template or a defined email body. If checked, the email sends a template; otherwise, it sends a custom email body.

Select Email Template: The ID of the email template used.
Email Target Object ID: The object ID of the Contact, Lead, or User to send the email to.
What Id: Used to ensure merge fields in the template contain correct data.

Save as Activity: Saves the email as an activity record on the recipientâ€™s page.
Org Wide Email Address: Sends the email using a Salesforce organization-wide email address.
Content Versions: Accepts the ID of a ContentDocument attachment with the Email Action.

If Use Template is unchecked, a custom email body can be sent to any email address:
TO: An array of email addresses or object IDs (max 100)
CC: An array of carbon copy addresses or object IDs (max 25)
BCC: An array of blind carbon copy addresses or object IDs (max 25)
Email Subject: The subject of the email
Email Body: The body of the email
Set HTML Body: Determines if the Email Body should be read as plain text or HTML
Attachment List: Supports attachment IDs merged from Data JSON
title: Using OmniScript Email Action in Salesforce
